newsitem.title: USA: Nasdaq ends higher with techs back in favor.
newsitem.headline: Nasdaq ends higher with techs back in favor.

text.p: Bargain-hunting and a firm bond market helped push Nasdaq stocks to a higher close.
A trader said the strong bounce in the Dow industrials through Wednesday encouraged buyers to get back into some of the technology issues.
The Nasdaq composite rose nearly seven to about 1217. Advances and declines were close to even.
Intel Corp shares continued their recovery, rising four to 138.
ESS Technology Inc fell 7-15/16 to 14-1/8 in active trading after it warned that price pressure in the audio and video markets is expected to result in narrower margins in the second quarter.
DSP Communications Inc fell 3-1/2 to 7-1/4 after the company said it expects lower revenue for at least one quarter as its csutomers focus on a new generation of products.

Andrew Corp skidded 12-1/8 to 23-1/2. The company reported second fiscal quarter earnings which were on target but revenues which were below expecations. Andrew said it expects order growth to pick up in the second half.
